text: Pythonic way to compare two lists and print out the differences
I have two lists which are guaranteed to be the same length.
I want to compare the corresponding values in the list (except the first item) and print out the ones which dont match.
The way I am doing it is like this

code:
i = len(list1)
if i == 1:
    print 'Nothing to compare'
else:
    for i in range(i):
        if not (i == 0):
            if list1[i] != list2[i]:
                print list1[i]
                print list2[i]

text: Is there a better way to do this?
